intro: Melissitus karkarensis, commonly known as the Karkar Mountain honeybee plant, is a flowering species native to the western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are usually pink or purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
